name: Power-up a Lightsaber

banner.text: Oh, there you are. On your journey you need to learn to wield the weapon of a Jedi, a Lightsaber. Below are code blocks, they control what you see on the canvas →.
Follow the instructions up here. Drag blocks and connect them to create code. The yellow beacon shows you the next step.

steps.grabBlockCopy: Add a Lightsaber to the canvas using the Draw Lightsaber block. Drag it with your mouse or finger into the code space →.
steps.connectCopy: Connect it inside of the Every 1 frames loop.

banner.text: Every 1 frame a Lightsaber will be drawn onto the canvas.

steps.grabBlockCopy: Now you'll add some code that lets you control the length of the blade with your hand. Drag the Force Kit: height block into the code space.
steps.connectCopy: Connect it to the beam %. This sets the length of the Lightsaber's blade.

steps.text: Every Lightsaber comes with a blade length adjuster. Move your hand up and down to control the blade’s length.

banner.text: Very good. Onto more adventures. Don't worry, I'll be there every step of the way. I've been told I have to.

tooltips.text: Connect code blocks together to make programs.
